We refer to Wikipedia articles on clinical knowledge for help. The tricuspid valve has three flaps called cusp which is attached to the papillary muscle by chordae tendineae, which prevents backflow from the right ventricle into the right atrium.

Therefore, the answer is (A).

The correct answer is A, B, C, D. The instructor uses several steps and conclusions to verify the major vessel leading away from the right ventricle. Firstly, she identifies the pulmonary trunk and inserts a probe into it, showing that the probe connects to the right ventricle. Then, she traces the superior vena cava into the right atrium, confirming that it carries blood to the lungs. Next, she confirms that the probed vessel (likely the pulmonary artery) carries blood from the right ventricle up towards the lungs. Finally, she follows the aorta emerging from the left ventricle to demonstrate systemic outflow from the right side.
